title: How to Move Music from Computer to iPhone

steps.title: Open iTunes on your computer.
steps.content: Open iTunes on your computer. You’ll find this in your Start Menu or Applications folder. With this method, you can move music from your computer to iPhone without syncing, so you will not lose songs that are on your iPhone but not on your computer. If you don’t have iTunes on your computer, you can download it from https://www.apple.com/itunes/download/ . Mac machines should have iTunes already installed.

steps.title: Connect your iPhone to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to your computer. You’ll want to use the USB cable that came with your phone. One end of the cable connects to your phone and the other end plugs into your computer. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the cell-phone icon in the upper left of iTunes.
steps.content: Click the cell-phone icon in the upper left of iTunes. iTunes will change to show you what’s on your phone.

steps.title: Click Summary.
steps.content: Click Summary . You’ll see this in the list under your iPhone’s name and icon.

steps.title: Click to check the box next to “Manually manage music and videos.”
steps.content: Click to check the box next to “Manually manage music and videos.” This will disable automatic syncing, so you can add or delete music from your iPhone.

steps.title: Click the back arrow above your iPhone’s name and icon.
steps.content: Click the back arrow above your iPhone’s name and icon. This will navigate you back to your music lists.

steps.title: Navigate to the song/artist you want to move to your iPhone.
steps.content: Navigate to the song/artist you want to move to your iPhone. You can navigate through your iTunes based on Artist, Genre, Songs, and Albums. Music must be added to your iTunes library on your computer before you can transfer it to your iPhone.

steps.title: Open iTunes on your computer.
steps.content: Open iTunes on your computer. You’ll find this in your Start Menu or Applications folder. Using this method, your iPhone will sync with your computer, and you will lose songs that are located on your iPhone but not on your computer. If you don’t have iTunes on your computer, you can download it from https://www.apple.com/itunes/download/ . Mac machines should have iTunes already installed.

steps.title: Connect your iPhone to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to your computer. You’ll want to use the USB cable that came with your phone. One end of the cable connects to your phone and the other end plugs into your computer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the cell-phone icon in the upper left of iTunes.
steps.content: Click the cell-phone icon in the upper left of iTunes. iTunes will change to show you what’s on your phone.

steps.title: Click Music.
steps.content: Click Music . You’ll see this in the list under your iPhone’s name and icon.

steps.title: Click to select the box next to “Sync Music.”
steps.content: Click to select the box next to “Sync Music.” A box will pop up warning you that all the songs on your iPhone will be replaced with the songs in this iTunes library.

steps.title: Click Remove and Sync.
steps.content: Click Remove and Sync . All the music on your iPhone will be replaced with the music in your iTunes library. You can continue with the defaults that sync your entire library or you can select to sync only selected playlists, artists, albums, and genres. This will give you the ability to control what is transferred between your computer and iPhone.

steps.title: Click Sync or Apply.
steps.content: Click Sync or Apply . This may take a few minutes.

steps.title: Open iTunes on your computer and mobile device.
steps.content: Open iTunes on your computer and mobile device. Using this method, your iPhone will sync with your computer each time they are on the same Wi-Fi network, and you will lose songs that are located on your iPhone but not on your computer.

steps.title: Make sure your phone’s and computer’s iTunes accounts are the same.
steps.content: Make sure your phone’s and computer’s iTunes accounts are the same. On an iPhone, open Settings, then tap on your name and photo. The email listed is your Apple ID. On your computer, go to the iTunes Store, and your Apple ID will be under the “Apple ID Account” header.

steps.title: Make sure your phone and computer are on the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Make sure your phone and computer are on the same Wi-Fi network. Your phone will only sync with your computer when it’s on the same Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Connect your iPhone to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to your computer. You’ll want to use the USB cable that came with your phone. One end of the cable connects to your phone and the other end plugs into your computer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the cell-phone icon in the upper left of iTunes.
steps.content: Click the cell-phone icon in the upper left of iTunes. iTunes will change to show you what’s on your phone.

steps.title: Click Summary.
steps.content: Click Summary . You’ll see this in the list under your iPhone’s name and icon.

steps.title: Click to select “Sync with this iPhone over Wi-Fi”.
steps.content: Click to select “Sync with this iPhone over Wi-Fi”. Every time your phone and computer are on the same Wi-Fi network, the phone is plugged in, and your computer has iTunes open, they will sync. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . Now your iPhone's iTunes music library will sync with your computer's iTunes music library every time they share a Wi-Fi network, your iPhone is plugged in to charge, and iTunes is open on your computer.
